intro: Blaeria kilimandjarica, commonly known as the Kilimanjaro bladderwort, is a carnivorous plant native to the high-altitude regions of East Africa. It belongs to the family Lentibulariaceae and is characterized by its small, aquatic or semi-aquatic habit. The plant possesses specialized bladder-like structures that trap and digest small aquatic organisms. It thrives in nutrient-poor environments, relying on its prey for essential nutrients. Its unique adaptations make it an intriguing subject for botanical study in extreme ecosystems.
